config.question: After 1690, most of the hostilities that involved American colonists __________.

choices.content: were limited to the North American continent
involved American colonists being sent to Europe to fight
were most frequently fought on the high seas

answer_3.response: The founders of England’s mainland colonies had engaged in intense local conflicts with the Indians, such as King Philip’s War (1675–1676) in New England. But after 1690, the colonists were increasingly involved in hostilities that originated on the other side of the Atlantic, in political and commercial rivalries between Britain and France. The external threat to security forced people in different colonies to devise unprecedented measures of military and political cooperation.
